benchmark_details.name: BRIEF ME (A Legal NLP Benchmark for Assisting with Legal Briefs)
benchmark_details.overview: BRIEF ME is a dataset focused on legal briefs that contains three tasks: argument summarization, argument completion, and case retrieval. The dataset aims to assist legal professionals in drafting and evaluating legal arguments through machine learning models.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of BRIEF ME is to support the development of models that assist in drafting legal briefs by providing diverse tasks related to legal argumentation.

data.source: Data collected from the Supreme Court of the United States briefs available online.
data.size: 3,753 briefs consisting of 23,332 summarization examples, 5,905 completion examples, and 91,086 citation retrieval examples.
data.annotation: Annotated by legal professionals and processed through LLM evaluation.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on performance against established benchmarks and human scoring.
methodology.interpretation: Performance is interpreted based on LLM judge ratings compared to human judgment.
methodology.validation: Validated through comparisons of LLM performance against human evaluations and through specialized legal benchmarks.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: The dataset contains legal texts which may include sensitive information; anonymity measures are implemented.
